unnormalised: Entertainment Buzz: Bollywood Bursts onto the Scene!
normalised: Entertainment Buzz: Bollywood Bursts onto the Scene!

unnormalised: Bollywood is officially back, baby! This week sees a clash of titans (or maybe just mildly overweight action heroes) with 3 films vying for your hard-earned rupees.
normalised: Bollywood is officially back, baby! This week sees a clash of titans (or maybe just mildly overweight action heroes) with three films vying for your hard earned rupees.

unnormalised: First up, "Agent Agni," promising more explosions than a Diwali fireworks display gone wrong. Critics are saying the plot is thinner than a masala dosa, but hey, at least the songs are catchy.
normalised: First up, "Agent Agni," promising more explosions than a Diwali fireworks display gone wrong. Critics are saying the plot is thinner than a masala dosa, but hey, at least the songs are catchy.

unnormalised: Then there's "Prem's Promise," a rom-com so sweet, itâ€™ll give you diabetes faster than eating an entire box of Mysore Pak. Get ready for cheesy dialogues and forced misunderstandings galore!
normalised: Then there's "Prem's Promise," a rom-com so sweet, it will give you diabetes faster than eating an entire box of Mysore Pak. Get ready for cheesy dialogues and forced misunderstandings galore!

unnormalised: Finally, we have the indie darling, "The Biryani Bandit," a film about a mysterious thief who only steals biryani from wedding feasts. Apparently, the lead actor gained 20 kg for the role. Talk about dedication!
normalised: Finally, we have the indie darling, "The Biryani Bandit," a film about a mysterious thief who only steals biryani from wedding feasts. Apparently, the lead actor gained twenty kilogram for the role. Talk about dedication!

unnormalised: Will Agent Agni save the world? Will Prem find his true love despite his meddling aunties? And most importantly, will the Biryani Bandit ever be caught? Find out at your nearest cinema hall (hopefully within 5 km of your house, because traffic, yaar)! Happy watching (and Onam wishes, BTW)!
